data.title: Skip this one for sure!
data.text: Maybe in the past Koshary was great, but at the moment, it is not worth your while! Starting with drinks, the hibiscus tea is way, way, way over sweetened. We had the tabbouleh, which was actually good, but came on a lettuce leaf that was awkward. The hummus was not very exciting and the pita seemed old. We ordered one of the Koshary specials, which essentially is everything okay the kitchen sink, covered in prepare tomato sauce and baked.  It seemed like something a teenage might concoct. And the chicken kabob was DRY as a bone. We also ordered the stuffed artichokes... same tomato sauce over what was supposed to be meat stuffing. Meh. Skip, move on.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: I really enjoyed the food and location of this restaurant! The chicken breast was well seasoned and the rice was so good. I will be back for sure

data.title: Lovely authentic Middle Eastern food
data.text: Great atmosphere & delicious variety of Egyptian & Mediterranean dishes. A must visit! Must try Koshary dish!!

data.title: Great restaurant in heart of downtown!
data.text: Very tasty food with nice decor! Have a lunch buffett during the week for $8.99! Recommend getting one of their daily specials.

data.title: Great food
data.text: The waiter recommended the lamb shank, so me and my husband both decided to order it. We were not dissapointed, it was savory and delicious. Can't wait to come back for more!

data.title: Order to go
data.text: I normally have a good experience with this restaurant.  However, today I walked over and ordered Baklava to go.  A gentleman took my order and informed me it would be right out.  I waited about 20 minutes or so.  Finally, one of the waitresses asked me if I'd been helped.  I told her that I ordered Baklava and had been there for 20 minutes.  She went to go check on my order.  When she came back, she informed me that it had been sitting at the counter the entire time and the young man that took my order assumed I had it.  This is very puzzling to me being that the gentleman that took my order also walked past me several times while serving others.

data.title: Great concept, poor execution
data.text: We went in a large group during a weekday lunch. As with most working people, we didn't have a lot of time to spend. We told them we were in a hurry, but they were in no hurry. We spent over an hour in the restaurant, for simple orders, basic food, and small portions. This place looks interesting on the inside, but it really needs to step up its game to get repeat customers.

data.title: It smelled great
data.text: As I was leaving the history Museum I and my wife were trying to decide where to eat. The smell coming out of this place was amazing so we stopped for a bite. I am not a fan of middle eastern food but it was delicious.

data.title: great middle eastern food!
data.text: wonderful food, great ambience, friendly staff, but don't be in a hurry. this restaurant leans a little more toward the European slow food concept. the meal is absolutely worth the wait, but there will be a wait.

data.title: Average
data.text: The menu is extensive and fun but the food was just average. It would be nice if they served alcohol.

data.title: Good buffet and quality
data.text: Koshary smartly started a lunch buffet recently, and it's good. Standard Mideast items --hummus, shawarma etc.-- and prepared well. Given limited quality options downtown, a welcome addition. Recommended.

data.title: Solid Egyptian Food
data.text: The lamb was cooked very well. The food arrived in a timely manner and the decor was noteworthy. Would go again.

data.title: I love Koshary's authentic decor, soft Egyptian music and good home cooking!
data.text:
Koshary serves a nice lunchtime buffet that gives a simple introduction to the taste of Egypt.
Koshary is named after the the Egyptian favorite dish made of noodles and vermicelli with lots of other ingredients.  It is tasty.  It is always a pleasure to visit this beautifully decorated establishment.
Peeve:  I wish ethnic restaurants would stop cutting pita and nan flat breads into tiny V-shaped wedges just to be fancy because when exposed to air the bread drys and hardens rapidly, turning to concrete, making it rather useless for good eating and scooping.  Pita or nan should be served halved or whole and torn at the table.

data.title: Tasty piece of Egypt
data.text: Had the Koshary with Kofta Kabab and it was fantastically delicious. The host was very accommodating and the decor was nice.

data.title: Great food/ Great atmosphere
data.text: Been here once and loved the food i got and was very feeling. The atmosphere is very nice and relaxing but yet fits the restaurant. No problems to say about this restaurant but would say to do the buffet to try everything.

data.title: Charming and sayisfying
data.text: After coming home from Egypt, I was in the mood for some Mediterranean fare, and Koshary always fits the bill!  If you are looking for an alternative to the same old thing downtown, stop in!

data.title: Delicious traditional Egyptian food with a twist
data.text: The food here is so fresh. The koshary here is great but my favorite is the mezze plate. My mom enjoyed the salad and the gyro and thought the meat was well spiced and high quality. We shared the kunefeh for dessert and it was delicious. Everything is made fresh and to order. Highly recommend!

data.title: Lunch Buffet
data.text: We have eaten at Koshary in the evening previously so when we heard they were now serving a lunch buffet we knew we had to try it. We loved it! The food was wonderful, the staff attentive and the atmosphere very pleasant.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: Glad I walked a few blocks down from the hotel to find something to eat. Came across Koshary. Wait staff talked me into getting the buffet. Glad I took their advice. I didn't think I was that hungry but ended up eating 2 plates!! The flavor's of the food were excellent! Perfect amount of spices. Worth going to if you're in the area.

data.title: Worthless food!
data.text:
oh wow where to begin! they always manage to get the order wrong! Today I ordered Kufta sandwich  with a side of mac and cheese + fries with garlic sauce. One bite of the sandwich made me sick to my stomach. mac and cheese was undercooked. Thank god I ordered the garlic sauce, had to settle for dipping bread in garlic sauce! 
This place is far from being a good middle eastern restaurant.
